Databases¶

User¶

class project.server.models.User(**kwargs)[source]¶

The User class has 4 attributes which are retrieved from google OAuth

id¶
Integer, primary_key=True
name¶
String(250), nullable=False
email¶
String(250), nullable=False
google_id¶
String(30), nullable=False

Category¶

class project.server.models.Category(**kwargs)[source]¶

The Category class has has 2 basic attributes id, name.

The 3rd attribute is the relationship with ‘User’ table.

There is another attribute ‘items’ which makes sure that when the category is deleted that all it’s children are removed too.

id¶
Integer, primary_key=True
name¶
String(250), nullable=False
user_id¶
Integer, ForeignKey('user.id')
user¶
relationship(User)¶
items¶
relationship("Item", cascade="save-update, merge, delete")

Item¶

class project.server.models.Item(**kwargs)[source]¶

The Item class has 4basic attr. id, name, description and date_time. The 3rd and 4th attr. are relationships to the User and Category tables

id¶
Integer, primary_key=True
name¶
String(250), nullable=False
description¶
String(250)¶
date_time¶
DateTime, nullable=False, default=datetime.utcnow()
category_id¶
Integer, ForeignKey('category.id')
category¶
relationship(Category)¶
user_id¶
Integer, ForeignKey('user.id')
user¶
relationship(User

Credential¶

class project.server.models.Credential(**kwargs)[source]¶

This Authentication class contains the authentication token and credentials.

It also cotains a relationship with the User.

id¶
Integer, primary_key=True
cred_token¶
String(150), nullable=False
cred_expiry¶
DateTime, nullable=False
cred_refresh¶
String(150), nullable=False
user_id¶
Integer, ForeignKey('user.id')
user¶
relationship(User
